steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"r4kl","text":"Put supernatant into a separate collection tube (label tube); 15 ml falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cm3td","text":"Add HBSS + EDTA+BSA buffer into tube with brain chunks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rhs9","text":"Put brain chunks into a smaller tube (corning 352063).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mr4f","text":"Add buffer to brain chunks and repeat cycle until procedure becomes inefficient (You should have whitish stuff and supernatant is clear) Should have between 15 and 25 ml whitish to yellowish supernatant per brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c2lrd","text":"Supernatant should become clear towards the end of dissociation (although there will still be white chunks of microglia left).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cp06s","text":"Lastly, transfer supernatant in 2 ml glass mortar (Wheaton, 358004), do once up \u0026 down with cell suspension SLOWLY.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7tei8","text":"Step is to remove and separate chunks of microglia.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bptk0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d1a1j","text":"Add 1.6-1.8 of supernatant into glass mortar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microglia isolation from mouse and culture (modified from UCSD)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40n87","text":"Use pestle to push down gently into liquid and then remove pestle and transfer supernatant to a new collection tube (50 ml falcon tube). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
